definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: Learned before, a table personnel, optimistic, cheerful, witty humor.
sentences.chinese: 博学多才，一表人才，开朗乐观，风趣幽默。

sentences.english: I would like to be a kindand knowledgeable peron like my teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我想成为一个想我的老师那样博学多才的好人。

sentences.english: Dr. Edward is a most learned scholar.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华博士是一位最博学多才的学者。

sentences.english: Brilliant like 007, we are knowledgeable in massive area, and keep learning.
sentences.chinese: 以007为榜样，永远博学多才而又善学快进。

definition: conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
